com.palamida.util.io

Class MoreFiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.palamida.util.io.MoreFiles

  • public final class MoreFiles
extends Object
    Static utility methods for working with Files.
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    Files

    • Method Detail

      • createParentDirs

        public static File createParentDirs(File path)
                             throws IOException
        Creates any necessary but nonexistent parent directories of the specified file. Note that if this operation fails it may have succeeded in creating some (but not all) of the necessary parent directories.

        Unlike Files.createParentDirs(File) this methods returns the specified file.

        Parameters:
        path - the specified file
        Returns:
        the specified file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getWorkingDirectory

        public static File getWorkingDirectory()
                                throws IOException
        Returns a File object representing the canonical path of the current working directory.

        For example the following code will simulate the Linux/Unix pwd command: System.out.println(IO.getCurrentDirectory());

        Returns:
        a File object representing the current working directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • newPrintWriter

        public static PrintWriter newPrintWriter(File path,
                         Charset charset,
                         boolean append,
                         boolean autoFlush)
                                  throws IOException
        Returns a print writer to the given file using the specified charset.
        Parameters:
        path - the given file
        charset - the character set to use when writing the file
        append - if true, then bytes will be written to the end of the file rather than the beginning
        autoFlush - if true, the println, printf, and format methods will flush the output buffer
        Returns:
        a print writer to the given file
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        Charsets

      • newPrintStream

        public static PrintStream newPrintStream(File path,
                         Charset charset,
                         boolean append,
                         boolean autoFlush)
                                  throws FileNotFoundException
        Returns a new PrintStream which writes to the given file using the specified charset.
        Parameters:
        path - the specified file
        append - if true, then bytes will be written to the end of the file rather than the beginning
        charset - the character set to use when writing to the file
        autoFlush - if true, the output buffer will be flushed whenever a byte array is written, one of the println methods is invoked, or a newline character or byte ('\n') is written
        Returns:
        new PrintStream which writes to the given file
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if an attempt to open the specified file fails

      • writeLines

        public static File writeLines(Iterable<String> lines,
              File path,
              Charset charset)
                       throws IOException
        Writes a list of strings (separating them using line-termination characters) to the given file using the specified charset.
        Parameters:
        path - the given file
        charset - the character set to use when writing the lines
        lines - an iterable of strings to be written to the file
        Returns:
        the given File object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        Charsets

      • separatorsToSystem

        public static String separatorsToSystem(String path)
        Returns the specified path string normalized to use the system separator as specified by File.separator.
        Parameters:
        path - the specified path
        Returns:
        the specified path string normalized to use the system separator as specified by File.separator

        Processes all the files and sub-directories in the specified path which satisfy the given filter.
        Parameters:

        filter - a file filter
        processor - the FileProcessor instance used to process the files
        Throws:
